column4: Hi guys. I am facing some problems installing samba on 11.04. Can anyone help?
Hi guys. I am facing some problems installing samba on 11.04. Can anyone pls help?
what problems exactly?
dpkg -l | grep samba
states iHR for samba package
any ideas?
you were trying to install samba directly throught dpkg or regularly through apt?
no interenet connection
so with dpkg directly
apt-cdrom add was giving some errors
so i was left with manually installing each package
i think i fucked up in some dependencies
and now its in a totally fucked up state.
sounds about right. no possibility of an internet connection?
there is. i have to lug it into another room.
if I do that, what commands to rectify the situation?
you could try and just do a regular package update, if that fails try a apt-get build-dep samba
ok. i shall try that.
thanks.
if the update fails try doing it directly with dpkg --configure --pending
will do. i am going offline now. will be back.
thank a lot! sudo apt-get -f install && sudo apt-get build-dep samba
did it for me.
cool
